Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • Person
      • Employee

  • public class Employee
extends Person
    The Employee public base class 'extends' the person class, and therefore inherits from the Person class. This inheritance relationship states that an Employee 'is a' Person. The class establishes the attributes of an employee (employee number, department, start date, salary, email), and sets and gets their values. All of the attributes are of type String, apart from employee number (int) and salary (float).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Adam Martin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      The Employee public constructor constructs a person using the attributes established above, and the attributes of the 'Person' class, which this class inherits from.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Employee

        public Employee(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String gender,
                java.lang.String dob,
                java.lang.String address,
                java.lang.String postcode,
                int newEmployeeNumber,
                java.lang.String newDepartment,
                java.lang.String newStartDate,
                float newSalary,
                java.lang.String newEmail)
        The Employee public constructor constructs a person using the attributes established above, and the attributes of the 'Person' class, which this class inherits from. The 'super' class is used to obtain the Person values and establish them as 'Employee' values also. An employee has a name, gender, date of birth, address, postcode, employee number, department, start date, salary and email address.
        Parameters:
        name, - gender, dob, address, postcode, newEmployeeNumber, newDepartment, newStartDate, newSalary, newEmail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This toString() method puts all of the 'Employee' attributes in a string, to avoid the Employee being outputted as byte code. The 'super' class is used when getting Person attributes to call them from the 'Person' class.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
